condition.description:
Your thyroid is a butterfly-shaped gland in your neck, just above your collarbone. It is one of your endocrine glands, which make hormones. Thyroid hormones control the rate of many activities in your body. These include how fast you burn calories and how fast your heart beats. All of these activities are your body's metabolism. If your thyroid is too active, it makes more thyroid hormones than your body needs. This is called hyperthyroidism.

Hyperthyroidism is more common in women, people with other thyroid problems, and those over 60 years old. Grave's disease, an autoimmune disorder, is the most common cause. Other causes include thyroid nodules, thyroiditis, consuming too much iodine, and taking too much synthetic thyroid hormone.

The symptoms can vary from person to person. They may include

  • Being nervous or irritable
  • Mood swings
  • Fatigue or muscle weakness
  • Heat intolerance
  • Trouble sleeping
  • Hand tremors
  • Rapid and irregular heartbeat
  • Frequent bowel movements or diarrhea
  • Weight loss
  • Goiter, which is an enlarged thyroid that may cause the neck to look swollen

To diagnose hyperthyroidism, your doctor will look at your symptoms, blood tests, and sometimes a thyroid scan. Treatment is with medicines, radioiodine therapy, or thyroid surgery. No single treatment works for everyone.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
condition.name: Hyperthyroidism
symptoms: Goiter (an enlarged thyroid that may cause your neck to look swollen)

carousel_items: Methimazole is typically taken 3 times a day. Once you're on the right dose, you may be able to take it once a day.
It may take 6 to 12 weeks before seeing an improvement of symptoms.
Methimazole may make you bleed more easily. Use a soft toothbrush and an electric razor.
Methimazole may lower your immune system. Try to avoid people who have an infection. Talk to your doctor if you suddenly get a fever.

basics.benefits_moa: Methimazole is an anti-thyroid medication. It blocks the thyroid gland from making thyroid hormones.
basics.bottom_line: Methimazole is an effective medicine to lower thyroid levels, but it requires frequent blood tests and monitoring for serious side effects.
downsides: You may need frequent dose adjustments when you first start taking Methimazole or if your health changes.
Periodic blood tests are needed to make sure you're getting the right dose and to watch for side effects.
Methimazole can cause birth defects. It is not recommended during the first trimester of pregnancy.
Because [name-common] can affect the liver, it isn't recommended for people who have liver problems.

downsides_processed.orig: You may need frequent dose adjustments when you first start taking Methimazole or if your health changes.
Periodic blood tests are needed to make sure you're getting the right dose and to watch for side effects.
Methimazole can cause birth defects. It is not recommended during the first trimester of pregnancy.
Because [name-common] can affect the liver, it isn't recommended for people who have liver problems.

upsides: For certain conditions, Methimazole is an effective anti-thyroid alternative to surgery or radioactive iodine.
Methimazole is preferred for children since other antithyroid medicines can cause serious liver damage.
For pregnant women, Methimazole is preferred during the second and third trimesters.

upsides_processed.orig: For certain conditions, Methimazole is an effective anti-thyroid alternative to surgery or radioactive iodine.
Methimazole is preferred for children since other antithyroid medicines can cause serious liver damage.
For pregnant women, Methimazole is preferred during the second and third trimesters.

drugs.name: Tapazole

carousel_items_processed.orig: Methimazole is typically taken 3 times a day. Once you're on the right dose, you may be able to take it once a day.
It may take 6 to 12 weeks before seeing an improvement of symptoms.
Methimazole may make you bleed more easily. Use a soft toothbrush and an electric razor.
Methimazole may lower your immune system. Try to avoid people who have an infection. Talk to your doctor if you suddenly get a fever.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Methimazole can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Methimazole can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Methimazole can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Methimazole can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening liver function
risks_warnings.description: Methimazole is processed by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

description_processed.orig: Methimazole is processed by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Methimazole may cause birth defects. Don't use Methimazole while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Methimazole may cause birth defects. Don't use Methimazole while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

clock.tip: Works better if taken with a high-fat meal.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisone is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisone is a common oral corticosteroid that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

upsides: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Short-term use in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Long-term use in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.

upsides_processed.orig: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.

Made my foot cramp and fall asleep. Also blurred vision!

SO SO hard to come off of...autoimmune chronic inflammatory issue--the rebound effect is vicious, and coming off prednisone makes me suicidal and want to self harm. Staying on prednisone makes me retain water and become hyper irritable.
Makes me aggressive
Caused weight loss, muscle wasting and thinning of the bones
Increases appetite..be aware
Weight gain
Never take on an empty stomach. Take the lowest dosage that is effective.
It has many more side effects than it's worth.. : /

drugs.name: Prednisone

labeled_indications.indication: Cerebral edema from a brain tumor or head injury

carousel_items_processed.orig: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Prednisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Prednisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: Its rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposis sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: Its rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposis sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your childs height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your childs height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Prednisone with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

description_processed.orig: Taking Prednisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

basics.benefits_moa: Propranolol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Propranolol is good for treating many heart problems and other problems in the body, but it has more side effects than other beta blockers. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure, heart attack, heart valve disorders, and abnormal heart rhythm.
Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure, heart attack, heart valve disorders, and abnormal heart rhythm.
Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure and controls heart rate.

userStories.tip: Nausea, dizziness and loss of energy.
I actually take it for essential tremor. It works very well. My hands no longer shake which is great.
The worst side effects for me...threw me into a deep depression. Horrendous.
I take it for occasional stage fright.

I've used it for public speaking, it works great totally stops irrriating hand or voice shakes. However; I experienced sudden dizziness after getting up quickly after a period of long period of sitting.
took this to manage shakes from lithium. it worked pretty well.

no issue; take as low of a dose as possible, remember to not skip doses, and prepare for a day when you don't need to take it any longer. completely stopped my anxiety from lasting more than a couple of minutes.
I started taking it for migraine prevention, but then found it completely rid me of my stage fright and issues with public speaking.
I'm taking very short amounts for anxiety since my doctor wants me to calm down but doesn't want to give me any drug that would mess up with my brain. It's working great!
Take it only when you need. It reduces the physical symptoms of anxiety, such as sweating, but it does not help with the mental aspect of anxiety

drugs.name: Propranolol

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased chest pain or risk of heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

description_processed.orig: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose. Your doctor may monitor your heart rate and rhythm.
risk_factors: Concurrent use of non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers, digoxin or clonidine

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose. Your doctor may monitor your heart rate and rhythm.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rare reports of skin rash have been reported which may be considered serious to life-threatening. If you notice a sudden severe skin rash with a fever, call your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rare reports of skin rash have been reported which may be considered serious to life-threatening. If you notice a sudden severe skin rash with a fever, call your doctor immediately.
